Key Match Events: Ghana endured more frustration on matchday 3 in qualifying for the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations after they were held to a goalless draw by Sudan at the Accra Sports Stadium on Thursday.
Alexander Djiku hit the crossbar with a header from Mohammed Kudus's cross on five minutes.
Ernest Nuamah lashed a shot just wide of goal in the 11th minute following an exquisite pass from Kudus.
Antoine Semenyo tested Mohamed Al Mustafa after bursting into the box on 17 minutes.
Kudus drew a smart save from Al Mustafa moments later after latching onto a rebound.
Sudan's best opportunity came on 72 minutes when they won a free-kick in a central position 30 yards out and Lawrence Ati-Zigi tipped a curling shot behind.
Mustafa Karshoum sent a firm header narrowly wide of the right post from the resulting corner.
Inaki Williams fired a shot across the face of goal from an acute angle on the right in the 85th minute after being released into the box.
Kudus somehow failed to turn the ball home from a yard out on 88 minutes after Williams missed Seidu's cross.
Williams squandered an even better chance in stoppage time after being picked out by Kudus inside the 18-yard area and Abdul Fatawu blazed over on the rebound following good work from the keeper.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Black Stars created a whole host of chances on a poor playing surface in Accra, but a lack of cutting edge in front of goal meant they remained winless at the halfway point of the qualifying campaign.

The situation in Group F is unchanged, with Otto Addo's side still third on two points, two behind the Falcons of Jediane and a further two adrift of leaders Angola, who host Niger on Friday, 11 October.
